newsitem.title: USA: HCIA crumbles after profit warning.
newsitem.headline: HCIA crumbles after profit warning.

text.p: Shares in health care information company HCIA Inc crumbled in morning trading on Tuesday after the company said weak revenues would drag its earnings well below analysts' expectations.

Late Monday the Baltimore-based company said it expected its third quarter earnings in a $0.10-to-$0.15-per-share range, before a one-time charge, and its fourth quarter results around $0.15 to $0.20 a share.
Analysts had forecast earnings of $0.29 a share for both quarters, according to First Call.
The stock was off 28-1/8, or 47 percent, to 31-7/8.
The stock topped Nasdaq's most actively traded list.

The company said it did not meet its third quarter revenue goals, mainly due to a shortfall in its Commercial Markets group. That unit focuses on larger customers in the pharmaceutical, medical device and supply, employer, and consulting firm markets.
HCIA develops and supplies clinical and financial information systems to the health care industry.
Analysts at Merrill Lynch and Alex. Brown downgraded the stock, although Alex. Brown later returned to a strong buy rating citing HCIA's precipitous fall.
Other healthcare information stocks were weak on Tuesday.

Medic Computer System Inc fell 2-5/16 to 34-1/16, Shared Medical Systems Corp lost one to 56, IDX Systems Corp dipped two to 33, HBO & Co slid 2-1/8 to 64-5/8 and Access Health Inc dropped 2-3/8 to 53-7/8.
